citations.narrative:
On June 26, 2024, power was lost to the 5-strand electric fence surrounding the black bear cub (3 cubs,5 month old at
time) enclosure and unsupervised contact between a bear cub and a member of the public occurred. Staff was notified via
radio that power was out, and the emergency response plan was implemented. Two staff ran for backup power chargers
and other keepers ran for positions between the electric fence and the chain link public barrier. One cub rolled through the
fence in the eastern-most cub enclosure after being tumbled by its companion. The cub began to climb the chain link
barrier fence before being picked up by a park guest and dropped back in the enclosure. No report of a scratch or bite to
any park guest was made. This occurred in the 2-to-3-minute timeframe before a keeper reached the position between
the electric and barrier fences. Staff arrived with backup power chargers within another 3-4 minutes. No injury to the cub
occurred.
Reliable power is necessary when electric fences are used to contain animals to prevent escape or injury to the animals
or public.
Corrected prior to inspection. Backup power sources remain in place.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
